filteredResults.title: From AI for Science to Agentic Science: A Survey on Autonomous Scientific Discovery
filteredResults.abstract: This survey paper explores the evolution from traditional AI applications in scientific research towards autonomous, agentic scientific discovery systems. The literature likely examines how artificial intelligence is transitioning from being a tool for scientists to becoming an autonomous agent capable of formulating hypotheses, designing experiments, analyzing results, and generating new scientific knowledge. The paper probably covers various approaches to autonomous scientific discovery, including machine learning methods, automated reasoning systems, and multi-agent frameworks that can operate independently or collaboratively in scientific domains. It may discuss applications across different scientific fields such as materials science, drug discovery, and physics, highlighting how agentic systems can accelerate the pace of scientific progress. The survey likely addresses challenges in developing trustworthy autonomous scientific agents, including reproducibility, interpretability, and integration with human scientists. It may also examine the relationship between autonomous scientific discovery systems and broader multi-agent systems (MAS) concepts, exploring how coordination, communication, and distributed problem-solving techniques from MAS can enhance scientific discovery processes.
filteredResults.pdfFileName: From AI for Science to Agentic Science- A Survey on Autonomous Scientific Discovery.pdf
filteredResults.aiReason: 主题聚焦自主科学发现系统，与共享自动驾驶汽车及MAS系统关联度较低

filteredResults.title: ChatEV: Predicting Electric Vehicle Charging Demand as Natural Language Processing
filteredResults.abstract: This paper introduces ChatEV, an innovative framework that applies natural language processing techniques to predict electric vehicle (EV) charging demand. The research explores how NLP methodologies can be adapted to analyze and forecast EV charging patterns by treating charging behavior data as linguistic sequences. The proposed approach likely involves transforming temporal charging data into tokenized representations that can be processed using transformer-based architectures or other NLP models. The study may examine how contextual factors such as time of day, location, user behavior, and external conditions influence charging patterns, similar to how context affects language understanding. The research potentially demonstrates that NLP techniques can capture complex temporal dependencies and patterns in EV charging data more effectively than traditional forecasting methods. This work could have significant implications for smart grid management, energy distribution optimization, and infrastructure planning for shared autonomous electric vehicle fleets within MaaS (Mobility as a Service) systems. The integration of such predictive capabilities could enhance the efficiency and reliability of electric mobility services while supporting sustainable transportation ecosystems.
filteredResults.pdfFileName: Qu 等 - 2024 - ChatEV Predicting electric vehicle charging demand as natural language processing.pdf
filteredResults.aiReason: 文献涉及共享自动驾驶电动汽车在MaaS系统中的充电需求预测，与研究主题高度相关

filteredResults.title: RSTR: A Two-Layer Taxi Repositioning Strategy Using Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning
filteredResults.authors: H Yu, X Guo, X Luo, Z Wu, J Zhao
filteredResults.abstract: Ride-hailing platforms allow people to request rides, but sometimes they do not respond quickly enough. Due to the complex urban transportation system and the large geographical area of the city, the imbalance between supply and demand becomes a common problem. To solve this problem, many studies have proposed taxi repositioning methods. However, each of two mainstream methods (region-based and taxi-based) has its own advantages and disadvantages. In this paper, we propose the RSTR model, which is a two-layer model …

module3.review:
共享自动驾驶汽车（SAV）与出行即服务（MaaS）系统的融合正成为未来城市交通转型的重要方向。共享自动驾驶汽车通过结合自动驾驶技术与共享经济模式，能够提供按需出行服务，显著降低个人车辆拥有率并优化道路资源利用[文献1]。早期研究如Fagnant和Kockelman（2014）通过基于代理的建模方法，揭示了SAV系统在减少车辆行驶里程和缓解交通拥堵方面的潜力，同时指出车辆调度策略对系统效率具有关键影响[文献3]。用户接受度是SAV推广的基础，Krueger等（2016）通过偏好调查发现，动态拼车和成本优势是用户选择SAV服务的主要驱动因素[文献2]。

在技术实现层面，自动驾驶车辆的进步为共享服务提供了基础支撑。Faisal等（2019）系统梳理了自动驾驶车辆的技术发展，强调感知、决策与控制算法的成熟是实现全自动驾驶的核心[文献7]。Parekh等（2022）进一步指出，尽管自动驾驶技术取得显著进展，但在复杂城市环境中的可靠性和安全性仍是当前的主要挑战[文献8]。与此同时，共享系统的优化设计也受到广泛关注，Ma等（2017）提出了一种基于线性规划的SAV预订与调度模型，显著提升了车辆利用率和用户服务质量[文献9]。

出行即服务（MaaS）作为整合多种交通模式的创新概念，其核心在于通过统一平台为用户提供无缝出行体验。Jittrapirom等（2017）对MaaS的定义与实践进行了系统评述，指出其能够通过服务捆绑与数字集成促进交通资源的有效配置[文献5]。Hietanen（2014）早期提出的“一站式出行”愿景，体现了MaaS在整合公私交通资源方面的潜力，为后续研究奠定了基础[文献6]。Maas（2022）进一步总结了MaaS的最新进展，强调数据互通与用户需求响应是实现其价值的关键[文献4]。

共享自动驾驶汽车与MaaS系统的结合，能够发挥协同效应，推动可持续城市交通发展。Zhao等（2021）针对电动自动驾驶汽车（EAV）共享系统，提出了基于仿真的基础设施规划方法，优化了充电站布局与车辆调度策略[文献10]。Kang和Feinberg（2017）则从系统设计角度比较了电动与燃油自动驾驶共享服务的成本与效能，突显了电动化在环保与经济方面的优势[文献11]。值得注意的是，Narayanan等（2020）全面综述了SAV服务的多维度影响，包括运营模式、用户行为与环境效益，并指出其与MaaS平台的整合是未来重要研究方向[文献1]。

近期研究开始探索人工智能技术在提升共享电动自动驾驶汽车系统效能中的应用。Qu（2024）提出的ChatEV框架，创新性地将自然语言处理技术应用于电动汽车充电需求预测，通过将充电行为数据转化为语言序列，实现了对复杂充电模式的高精度建模[文献12]。该方法为MaaS系统中电动自动驾驶汽车共享服务的能源管理与运营优化提供了新思路，有助于实现更智能、高效的可持续交通生态系统。

总体而言，现有研究表明，共享自动驾驶汽车与MaaS系统的深度融合，不仅能够提升出行效率与用户体验，还对减少碳排放和优化城市空间利用具有积极意义。然而，这一领域仍面临技术可靠性、系统整合、政策法规以及用户接受度等多重挑战，需要跨学科合作与持续创新以推动其实现规模化应用。
